meanings.sent1: The school play was a prelude to the main theater production.
meanings.sent2: The prelude to the concert featured a talented violinist.
meanings.sent3: The magician's prelude involved pulling a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise was a prelude to the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain was a prelude to the storm that followed.

meanings.definition: An action or event serving as an introduction to something more important.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful meeting was a prelude to the intense negotiations that followed.
meanings.sent2: The prelude to the battle was a series of diplomatic talks.
meanings.sent3: The prelude of the movie set the stage for the thrilling adventure ahead.
meanings.sent4: The first snowfall was a prelude to the winter season.
meanings.sent5: The quiet before the storm was a prelude to the chaos that ensued.

meanings.sent1: The research conducted was a necessary prelude to the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The prelude to the project involved gathering all the required materials.
meanings.sent3: The prelude to the party was setting up decorations and music.
meanings.sent4: The warm-up exercises were a prelude to the intense workout.
meanings.sent5: The announcement was a prelude to the official launch of the campaign.
